issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: runapp.py currently reads the port number from the environment, and defaults to 8888 if it isn't there.  It should instead try to get a port number from the config file before choosing 8888.
fields.summary: runapp.py should read port number from config file

comments.body:
Capturing some notes here from an IRC discussion with [~viglesias]…

Looks like we can ditch runapp.py (and paste.deploy) and use "pserve console.ini" directly with gunicorn.

Here's the relevant config in console.ini...

###########################
# WSGI server configuration
###
[server:main]
use = egg:gunicorn#main
host = 0.0.0.0
port = 8888
workers = 8
worker_class = gevent

Capturing notes from an IRC discussion with [~viglesias]…

Looks as though we can ditch paste.deploy and runapp.py and use "pserve console.ini" directly if we use the following deployment config in console.ini…

###########################
# WSGI server configuration
###
[server:main]
use = egg:gunicorn#main
host = 0.0.0.0
port = 8888
workers = 8
worker_class = gevent

[~kgill]

This got me further along. When will this change be in the code?

[~viglesias]: Ugh, we can't ditch PasteDeploy since Pyramid pins it as a hard requirement (see https://github.com/Pylons/pyramid/blob/master/setup.py#L48)

Looping in [~Rocky] to suggest any possible workarounds
Why does it matter if pyramid depends on it?  Doesn't mean we have to use it...
[~Rocky]: oh, reading http://docs.pylonsproject.org/projects/pyramid/en/latest/narr/paste.html indicates that PasteDeploy is required if we load configuration from a .ini file
What actually uses runapp.py? I use pserve console.ini from the launcher script and that just works. I change the port in the console.ini and the app is running on that defined port.
[~dkavanagh] python runapp.py is what we're using for production deployments.

Thats what I would like to use in the init script as well. With the
gunicorn change.


On Wed, Mar 5, 2014 at 10:50 AM, David Kavanagh (JIRA) <




-- 

*_________________________*

*Victor Iglesias - *Director of Quality and Release

*Eucalyptus Systems*

www.eucalyptus.com

Follow us on Twitter <http://twitter.com/#!/eucalyptus>

Like our Facebook
Page<http://www.facebook.com/pages/Eucalyptus-Systems-Inc/164828240204708>

Keep up-to-date with
us<http://go.eucalyptus.com/Sign-Up-for-Cloud-Computing-News.html?Offer=Other&OfferDetails=Sign%20Up%20for%20Cloud%20Computing%20News&LeadSourceDetails=Eucalyptus%20Website&OfferURL=http%3A%2F%2Fgo.eucalyptus.com%2FSign-Up-for-Cloud-Computing-News.html>

*_________________________*

I saw an error when using pserve with the gnuicorn change in the console.ini. First, it complained about gevent being called from more than one thread. Then, it failed to start up. Here are the 2 errors.

.. some stack trace deleted...
  File "/Users/dkavanagh/Envs/koala/lib/python2.7/site-packages/gevent/hub.py", line 135, in get_hub
    raise NotImplementedError('gevent is only usable from a single thread')
NotImplementedError: gevent is only usable from a single thread

and
2014-03-05 14:01:24 [35525] [ERROR] Connection in use: ('0.0.0.0', 8888)
2014-03-05 14:01:24,399 ERROR [gunicorn.error][Dummy-1] Connection in use: ('0.0.0.0', 8888)
2014-03-05 14:01:24 [35525] [ERROR] Retrying in 1 second.

4 times, till it gave up.
[~dkavanagh] Hmm, I haven't seen that gevent error.  Wondering if there's something unique about your setup.  Are you using a patched version of Boto?
[~dkavanagh] The "connection is use" error is when you fire up multiple instances of the console without using a distinct port.
Since it was on my Mac, I'll have to try this out on a CentOS box. though, it would be annoying to require different config for deploy and devel (on Mac). But, let me test more first.
[~dkavanagh] runapp.py works just fine on my Mac
I think you misunderstood. I wasn't using runapp.py, I was using pserve console.ini with the console.ini changes as Vic mentioned.

I killed the other python processes I found running and now the app runs without that second error. It looks like the server doesn't nicely clean up after itself when running in this mode. In 3.4, I had a thread killer that would clean those up.
I still get the gevent error. Even when turning off the boto logging thread.

I've run pserve w/ gunicorn and it looks good to me.
I've setup a pserve script that runs on centos using the current package dependencies and a source install of the console itself. I've added in the path references for our zope and beaker packages. I don't see any svg issue that I can identify. I'm seeing icons rendering properly on FF and Chrome on OS X.
Doing this (using the modified pserve script vs runapp.py) allows the console.ini to be used for all config.
Regarding the number of gunicorn workers, we should run at least 8 if not more. We allowed up to 50 threads on the 3.4 console. Since most workers will be I/O bound, not CPU bound, allowing a good number of workers by default shouldn't be a big deal.

The UI team dev cloud is currently hosting this code; http://10.111.1.119:8888/

I've been working on the init script and daemonizing process. Things basically work, but I'm dealing with permissions issues. For example, the eucaconsole user can't write /var/log/eucaconsole.log, so I'm trying creating and setting ownership on /var/log/eucaconsole/ and writing console.log in there. Now seeing issues with permissions on session-keys-ini, investigating.

I got past the permission error by specifying:
session.keyini = /etc/eucaconsole/session-keys.ini

in the console.ini. I'm checking that change into the default file.

The issues I'm aware of are these:
 - can't write log file, so might need to "mkdir /var/log/eucaconsole", "chown eucaconsole /var/log/eucaconsole", and change the console.ini to write a file within that.
 - don't get any log output from "our" code in the console, but I do see output from pyramid setting up workers. Need to confirm we log properly (small tweak to config file.. PUSHED)
 - "service eucaconsole stop" produces a lot of errors. Seems that whatever shuts down the worker threads also tries to remove the eucaconsole.pid file. Might need to modify some logic in the daemonizing stuff so all children of fork don't run shutdown hook (cleanpid) (FIX PUSHED)
runapp.py not used (and removed from workspace). eucalyptus/eucaconsole-rpmspec workspace contains executable (eucaconsole), init script and rpm spec that are used by package.
codey thing reviewer responsible move to done
Verified the port number is read from console.ini and confirmed runapp.py is no longer present or needed.
codey thing
